alert.note: Alert for Crane; Ector; Upton; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 6:24PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Ector, east central Ward, Crane and southwestern Upton Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Grandfalls to 8 miles southwest of Crane to 6 miles south of McCamey. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. Strong wind gusts are expected ahead of this line of storms, along with blowing dust that may produce localized significant visibility redictions. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Blowing dust may reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Crane, McCamey, Rankin, Penwell, Crane County Airport, Upton County Airport, King Mountain and Pleasant Farms. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 89 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for western Texas.
